answers.answer: For what it's worth when my ex started suboxone she stayed with me.she was skin and bones when she went into detox,maybe 110-115 at 5'4'. When she came out within like maybe a month or so she was up to 160,then by 4 months she tolled in at 170. Now i know she was malnourished due to the addiction and withdrawls but never to 170. 4years later she is still on sub (she was as far as i know yet in march),but she has dropped to maybe 135-140......I have my suspicions she is using again,but her memory is shot also. Honest i have to have her write down the times i will pick up the kids,which day etc. She can't remeber anything at all. i think it not only was ingesting truck loads of oxy etc, but since the sub it is worse.So the wait gain maybe sub related but i never saw the swelling in her feet. The big thing is the emotional issues and the lack of memory. , Jim

Hey hun..  I have had some foot swelling recently.. None that I noticed when on Sub but I was on it a very short time. Last week my feet swelled so much I couldn't slip on my shoes.. Went away the next dayl. I would see a doctor if it were me. Even an urgent care or walk in clinic.. you are having edema from something.. If your body is holding water like that I would be concerned.. Do it tommorrow..

oh yeah.. the memory loss is just unbelievable to me...my mind was always good with memory, one of my positives...not now...i have a hard time remembering the day, and i am not kidding about that one bit..i have to hold the mouse pointer over the time down in the right hand corner of my monitor about 3-5 times a day (you know what i mean, the day,date,year and time pops up?)  and i really cant afford to gain anymore weight i am quite overweight already so the weight gain i am worried about, but the swelling has me very concerned,   thanks for the input and please let me know if anything of this nature concerning your ex pops up.    peace&love

I'm not on sub or any of those meds, but I had considerable swelling of my ankles and feet a few weeks go.  My wife, being a nurse, immediately had me get a doctor appointment.  As I recently (3 months ago) had a pacemaker inplanted, her concern was that it was cardiac related (it is a sign of congestive heart failure) and I'm also a diabetic and there was some concern there on her part..though my blood sugar has been fine and my overall A1C number is right where it's supposed to be.I went to the doc (well, in this case a PA as my doc was booked up and she checked out all my recent cardiac studies which showed that I have a "normal"heart for a 57 year old with no signs of any serious condition that would leadto the swelling.  She prescribed me (can't think of the name" a diuretic which led to a lot of peeing and ultimately all the swelling went down and hasn't returned..we don't know what caused it.. Doc suspected it could be related toLyme disease (which I also have...picture of perfect health, eh?).At any rate, I'd suggested getting to your doctor or a doctor (urgent care, whatever) and get it checked out.I ultimately lost around 10lbs of precious bodily fluids.Jim

yeah i guess your probably right, i am kind of neglectful of things like this (until it gets real bad) so people dont think i am some type of hypochondriac freak...but when my hubby mentions emergency room, then i get worried so i thought i would take the chance and see if maybe(someone here could answer my question)  the suboxone or fibro or (with my luck lately) some other health crisis....thanks for the input hun...how are you doing and feeling?  i will check back in little while....i have to clean up dinner table...XO

actually diabetes has been on my mind as i am overweight also, what are all of the symptoms of type 2 diabetes?  i am worried of that also because of the dry mouth and thirst, is there any other way to tell other than going to the doctor?...thanks...peace&love

I am on day 5 of sub. Although it is not at lot of time, I do NOT have any ankle swelling.With that said, I do have ankle swelling, but it is from the heart disease that I have. My regular doctor checks my ankles all the time. It is very serious.I have to suggest that you get somewhere, ER or another doc, immediately!I don't mean to scare you but if it is from the heart (and we don't know if it is in your case), it is not a good sign.

excessive thirst is a real good sign.  I used to go through a half gallon of OJ a night and lots of water.  I also had "tingling" feelings in my limbs...hands, fingers, etc.  I also had some problems with my "equipment" not working..I'm trying to remember them all.  My doctor, having heard my description, suspected it, and had a full range of blood and urine tests.I don't know of any surefire way of finding out without all of those tests.  If you know of someone who is a type 2 diabetic, ask him/her to test a blood sample with their meter.  It doesn't hurt and results take second..make sure you are fasting for 8-10 hours.  If the results are well into the 100's or 200's  that's when you want to see a doctor (PLEASE DON'T TAKE WHAT I'M SAYING AS FROM AN EXPERT).  If you think you could be, go to the doctor.Mine is pretty much under control with diet and medication (glucophage)..i do not take insulingo to www.diabetes.org    for more info (that's the American Diabetes Assoc website).Between the swelling and the thirst, I'd get myself to a doctor TOMORROW.Jim

now i am getting really scared...i am a heavy smoker too, i might add, and i do have tingling in my fingers and toes...but i also have fibromyalgia and carpel tunnel and foot problems such as plantar facitius (sp) and heel spurs....  but i am freaked out i watched my friend go through a type of pregnancy induced cardiomyopathy, cant remember the exact name but swelling was her first symptom...i guess i better call and get in to see a doctor somewhere...my regular doc., is out of town on his honeymoon...thanks for all of the input , i appreciate it because i am the type of person to say well if it doesnt hurt and i can still function then i must be fine....   44 lbs of weight gain, is that from the swelling, or possible diabetes or possible heart problem  or am i just simply getting fatter...i swore i would never be the type to have "cankles!"  is the weight gain i have had considered alot for the time frame?  or can someone just gain 44 lbs from eating too much, which i add i have not changed anything...just medications.  (anti-depressant, anti-anxiety and the suboxone) thank you so much for the time...
please tell me this (going to er) is something that can wait another night or 2...can it, or am i in real serious trouble here?
wait honey.. go first thing in the morning...don't wait too long ..LOL
and please let us know what they have to say to you.  Will keep you in thoughts and prayers.Jim

the swelling has gotton worse just since my last post, the tops of my feet near my toes is now getting a kind of bruised feeling, and just now when i sat down to post here..it felt like the skin on my knees was going to split open from being so tight from the swelling. please tell me i am not, like going to die in my sleep or something... i guess thats one way to avoid withdrawals!!!!  LOL LOL!  oh the drama in my life....LOL!
So where are you now with all of this?JIm

well i called MY doctors office to see who was covering him, and of course cant see me until thurs. afternoon, they dont seem to think its anything immediate to worry about, so i actually called my suboxone doctor and she is not sure what it could be from but wants me to take a water pill called fourezimide (i know its spelled wrong) until either thursday or until my doctor is back from his honeymoon, but she did tell me if i start to experience any other symptoms (like hard to breath, change of color in my lips and nails and if the swelling continues to get worse even with the water pills for me to go directly to the E.R.     so i guess i am at the wait and see if i die in my sleep time....just kidding...but right now my feet are so swollen that my toes do not touch the floor, so its continued to get worse, i will pick up my prescription for water pill tomorrow morning at the pharmacy... thank you for your advice and concern and i hope these pills work!!!   do you know of how long it takes for a medication like that to start working? and also do i avoid drinking water or should i drink more water?  thanks again...

I live in NH also, i know it says something different in my profile, i picked NE for new england,,,i am in very northern NH 1 hour from canadian border...where abouts are you located?  i dont mean exact address... that is something you definately dont want on the internet...LOL...thanks again!!

God, I'm so sorry. Definitely consider an E.R. visit. It could be diabetes...now, I won't swear to this, but I could swear I read something somewhere that suboxone can cause a diabetic type state (this is a rare occurrence). In other words, you aren't diabetic, it's just a reaction. It's still JUST as dangerous.Again, I'm not 100% sure here I'm thinking of the right thing here, I'll take some time to look through all the stuff I've been dumping into a file and see if I can find the reference. But if it keeps getting worse, you seem to know what to do.Good luck with this, I mean it!

Here, check this link out. It gives a detailed description of side effects. Now THIS link doesn't describe the above effect, but it does mention "other side effects" (and yours sound like "other side effects" possibly!) and gives an emergency contact number.Link to Suboxone (buphenorphine)http://www.nlm.nih.gov/medlineplus/druginfo/medmaster/a605002.htmlMy wife wishes you well, is very concerned and strongly suggests the E.R.
i think you are ringing a bell for me...seems to me now i remember reading something like that also...time to do some research...thanks so much...i'll be in touch...

Hi wait:I do think you should also get in to see the dr. but I also think you should taper and get off the sub. Longterm sub maintanence is very bad for you. Sub is best taken short term and then jumping off. Memory loss is just one of the problems of long term sub use. Take care and let us know how you are.Jackie

question: i have been having some terrible swelling lately, it has continued to get worse over 10 day time frame, i cannot wear any of my shoes,sandals or flip flops.  it looks like i have rubber bands around my "cankles"  (a.k.a. ankles) i have rolls from the swelling i have also gained close to 14 lbs in 19 days. i have gained a total of 44 lbs since starting suboxone at end of may.  my mouth  is continuesly dried up (pasty) like cotton mouth after smoking pot, and i am always drinking something because of dry mouth, so i know i'm not dehydrated...i am just wondering if anyone else has had any of these symptons...fladdict...wondering if you have had anything like this possibly related to fibro....i actually am getting quite concerned over this...my husband just insisted i go to the emergency room, NOT!... my doctor is on vacation for another week on his honeymoon, anyones input would be appreciated and lesson my worries..thanks
title: Fladdict and sub.parients
